CWEs: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
description: The function directly assigns a value to the 'innerHTML' property of an element. This can lead to Cross-site Scripting (XSS) attacks if the 'index' variable is controlled by the user or can be manipulated in any way. An attacker could inject malicious scripts that would be executed when the page is loaded.
